channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WV

item.title: Report X-2023080067
item.description:
Report X-2023080067

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: CHARLESTON
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: opened up trailer and leaking hazmat was found at the tail of the trailer. Package was bagged in a hazmat bag and contained in the hazmat storage area. third party hazmat cleanup service came in and neutralized the acid and placed them in drums for disposition. DescribePack: third party found that there were loose caps which resulted in failure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HazMats were contained and the third party clean up crew neutralized the acid that was spilled.

item.title: Report X-2023071071
item.description:
Report X-2023071071

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: CHARLESTON
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed wetness on outside of hazmat package prior to loading onto work area. Manager was called to inspect package, QA was called to pull package from line and get it in a hazmat bag and tote. DescribePack: 1 cap on one can of alcohol appears to have not been secured properly which allowed contents to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package immediately placed in hazmat bag and tote and taken to hazmat station for processing.

item.title: Report E-2023070770
item.description:
Report E-2023070770

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: Grafton
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06/23/2023, at 1332 hours, personnel in the CSXT Grafton Yard discovered TILX 198280, a loaded tank car of Alcohols, N.O.S., leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, West Virginia DEP, and National Response Center were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2023-0623-00192). Specialized Professional Services, Inc, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the reclosing pressure relief device stuck in the open position that resulted in the release of lading while the car was in motion. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative, Ms. Judy Watson of Valero Marketing, phone (210) 241-2886, email judy.watson@valero.com. Contractor personnel manually reset the pressure relief device. The contents of the car were transloaded without incident, and the car will move to a shop of the car owner's choice with an OTMA-1 per 49 CFR 174.50. (FRA assigned Investigators have been updated) The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is required. Cause Code: 422 NARRI: 32
